.
Wartime Service Requirement for Survivors Pension
Under
38 U.S.C. 1541(a)
and
1542
, a Veteran’s survivors may be eligible for pension if the Veteran
met the wartime service requirement for Veterans Pension, or
at the time of death, was in receipt of (or entitled to receive) compensation for an SC disability based on service during a period of war.
Important
:  If the Veteran had less than 90 days of wartime service, basic entitlement to Survivors Pension exists if the Veteran was in receipt of, or entitled to receive compensation or retirement pay by reason of wartime disability, even though
such a grant of benefits is a clear and unmistakable error, and
action to sever service connection under
38 CFR 3.105(a)
is pending at the time of death, in the absence of illegality or fraud.
References
:  For more information on the wartime service requirement for
Veterans Pension, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart i, 1.2.a
Survivors Pension, see
38 CFR 3.3(b)(4)
, and
Section 306 Death Pension, see
38 CFR 3.3(b)(3)(i)
.
